title: Can IELTS help in improving written skills for exams? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for the A2A. Certainly! It would improve your written skills for any exam that requires writing skills. When you prepare for the writing module of IELTS, you learn to put your ideas in proper paragraphs. You learn to convey your thoughts in crisp and clear manner (because you have the word and time limit), you learn to use proper punctuation as they are very important and if not used correctly, can change the meaning of the sentence altogether. You subconsciously start focusing on your grammar as well. It will definitely improve your written skills. You will know how to avoid giving information that is not required and if you want to use these skills in your academics, it will help you manage your time very well. You will learn to structure your thoughts and put them to words really well if you are practicing and analyzing your write ups well. This practice will definitely help you in future as well, when you are on a job and have to mail people from global community on daily basis and respond to their emails with proper information.

To some extend, yes. IELTS sections do aim at testing the listening, reading ,writing and speaking skills and the practice papers to prepare for these do help. But if you are going for coaching classes where they teach you the tips and tricks to face the IELTS exAm , it is not going to help you. These classes are meant to help you specifically crack the exAm and not to improve your basic english skills. For instance, to tackle the writing section a stand template is provided in these classes to answer letter based or essay based questions. At the end of the day, IELTS coaching classes would not replace your traditional english class.

Hello dear… The International English Language Testing System, or IELTS™, is an international standardized test of English language proficiency for non-native English language speakers. It is jointly managed by the British Council, IDP: IELTS Australia and Cambridge Assessment English, and was established in 1989. IELTS assesses all of your English skills — reading, writing, listening and speaking, and is designed to reflect how you will use English at study, at work, and at play, in your new life abroad. So, u can understand that this will surely enhance ur writing skills whether exams or other writing works… All the very best….!!!!!

If you want to improve only your writing skills then please don't join some academy of IELTS as they teach much more than what you desire and it will be you wastage of time if you don't need that. To improve writting skills, start writing. Start writing whenever and wherever tou get chance, you may start from quora itself or your diary. Doing this will not only help you but certainly save you precious time and money. Thanks for reading and i hope you will listen to my advice.

IELTS is an exam in itself. Unless you are spending way too much time in preparing for IELTS! IELTS is just a language proficiency test that is taken by candidates applying for future immigration/to study abroad. There is a 150 words letter writing and 250 words essay writing. Your score in writing helps in gauging your skills in writing. This will no way help you in writing exams in the future.

To improve your writing skill you just need immense practice. It’s not important to join IELTS to improve your writing skill. But, to check where you stand or your writing skill you can take part in IELTS test.

Sure , Because while practicing for IELTS you will go through more vocabularies , grammar , Time management ..etc & of course these things will help you to improve your writing skills in exams to some extent.
